# 2. Line graphs, density and gross profit by year

## 2.1. Weed density
Specify the labels for the panels.   
```{r panel-labels-line-den}
initDR3.labs <- c("(i) Low density,\n low resistance", "(ii) Low density,\n high resistance", "(iii) High density,\n high resistance") # new
names(initDR3.labs) <- c("LD-LR", "LD-HR", "HD-HR") # original
```

Specify the plot.  
```{r plot-line-den}
plot_line_den <- ggplot(df_line_den, 
       aes(x = year, y = hvh, group = scenario, colour = scenario)) +
  facet_wrap(~initDR3, labeller = labeller(initDR3 = initDR3.labs)) +
  geom_ribbon(aes(ymin = hvh_95ci_l, ymax = hvh_95ci_u, fill = scenario), 
              alpha = 0.1, # controls transparency
              linetype = "blank" # gets rid of upper and lower lines
              ) +
  scale_fill_manual(
    name = "Scenario",
    values = c("#00306F", # BAU, madison blue
               "#00C2F9", # MIT, capri blue
               "#005FCC"  # CWW, royal blue
               )
    ) +
  geom_line() +  
  scale_color_manual(
    name = "Scenario",
    values = c("#00306F", # BAU, madison blue
               "#00C2F9", # MIT, capri blue
               "#005FCC"  # CWW, royal blue
               )
    ) +
  theme_classic() +
  labs(x = "Year in rotation", 
       y = "Proportion of field with economically- \n damaging Black-grass density") +
  theme(
    panel.grid.major = element_blank(), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title = element_blank(),
    axis.title=element_text(size=22),
    axis.text.x=element_text(size=rel(2)),
    axis.text.y=element_text(size=rel(2)),
    legend.title=element_text(size=22),
    legend.text=element_text(size=20),
    strip.background = element_rect(color = "white",
                                    fill = "grey"),# colour of rectangle round region labels
    strip.text = element_text(size = 18)
    ) +
  theme(legend.position="none")

plot_line_den
```

## 2.2. Gross profit

First, specify the labels for the panels.  
```{r panel-labels-line-gp}
initDR3.labs <- c("(i) Low density,\n low resistance", "(ii) Low density,\n high resistance", "(iii) High density,\n high resistance") # new

Then specify the plot.

  facet_wrap(~initDR3, labeller = labeller(initDR3 = initDR3.labs)) +

    name = "Scenario",
    values = c("#00306F", # BAU, madison blue
               "#00C2F9", # MIT, capri blue
               "#005FCC"  # CWW, royal blue
               )
    ) +
  theme_classic() +
  labs(x = "Year in rotation", 
       y = "Annual gross profit (Â£/ha)") +
  theme(
    panel.grid.major = element_blank(), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    #plot.title = element_text(size=18, face="bold"),
    plot.title = element_blank(),
    axis.title=element_text(size=22),#18
    axis.text.x=element_text(size=rel(2)),#1.7
    axis.text.y=element_text(size=rel(2)),#1.7
    legend.title=element_text(size=22),#18
    legend.text=element_text(size=20),#16
    strip.background = element_rect(color = "white",
                                    fill = "grey"),# colour of rectangle round region labels
    strip.text = element_text(size = 18)#16
    ) #+ 
  #ggtitle("(b)") 

plot_line_gp
```

95% CIs show variation due to region and soil type.

# 3. Scatter plots, gp and wheat yield
## 3.1. Gross profit scatter plot

Specify the labels for the panels.   
```{r panel-labels-scatter-gp}
region.labs <- c("Northern England", "Central England", "Eastern England") # new
names(region.labs) <- c("north", "central", "east") # original

soiltype.labs <- c("Heavy soil", "Medium soil", "Light soil") # new
names(soiltype.labs) <- c("heavy", "medium", "light") # original
```
 
Specify the plot annotations. These will show the **numbers of spring crops** in each rotation.
```{r annotations-scatter-worstcase-oc}
anno_gp <- data.frame(
  x = c("HD-HR","HD-HR","HD-HR",
        "HD-HR","HD-HR","HD-HR",
        "HD-HR","HD-HR","HD-HR",
        "LD-HR","LD-HR","LD-HR",
        "LD-HR","LD-HR","LD-HR",
        "LD-HR","LD-HR","LD-HR",
        "LD-LR","LD-LR","LD-LR",
        "LD-LR","LD-LR","LD-LR",
        "LD-LR","LD-LR","LD-LR"
        ),
  y = c(150,150,150,
        150,150,150,
        150,150,150,
        150,150,150,
        150,150,150,
        150,150,150,
        150,150,150,
        150,150,150,
        150,150,150
        ),
  # numbers of spring crops:
  lab = c("3", "3", "3", # north, HD-HR
          "3", "3", "3", # central, HD-HR
          "4", "4", "4", # east, HD-HR
          
          "2", "2", "2", # north, LD-HR
          "2", "2", "2", # central, LD-HR
          "1", "1", "1", # east, LD-HR
          
          "1", "1", "1", # north, LD-LR
          "1", "1", "1", # central, LD-LR
          "0", "0", "0"  # east, LD-LR
          ),
  region = c("north",   "north",   "north", 
             "central", "central", "central",
             "east",    "east",    "east",
             "north",   "north",   "north", 
             "central", "central", "central",
             "east",    "east",    "east",
             "north",   "north",   "north", 
             "central", "central", "central",
             "east",    "east",    "east"
             ),
  soiltype = c("heavy", "medium", "light",
               "heavy", "medium", "light",
               "heavy", "medium", "light",
               "heavy", "medium", "light",
               "heavy", "medium", "light",
               "heavy", "medium", "light",
               "heavy", "medium", "light",
               "heavy", "medium", "light",
               "heavy", "medium", "light"
               ),
  scenario = c("MIT", "MIT", "MIT",
                "MIT", "MIT", "MIT",
                "MIT", "MIT", "MIT",
                "MIT", "MIT", "MIT",
                "MIT", "MIT", "MIT",
                "MIT", "MIT", "MIT",
                "MIT", "MIT", "MIT",
                "MIT", "MIT", "MIT",
                "MIT", "MIT", "MIT"
                )
           ) %>% 
  dplyr::mutate(
    region = factor(region,
                    levels = c("north", "central", "east")
                    ),
    soiltype = factor(soiltype,
                    levels = c("heavy", "medium", "light")
                    )
  )
```

Specify the plot.   
```{r plot-scatter-gp}
plot_scatter_gp <- ggplot(df_scatter_gp %>% 
         filter(!scenario=="CWW"),
       aes(initdenres_collapsed, gp, 
                   colour = scenario, 
                   shape = scenario)) + 
  #geom_point(size = 4) +
  facet_grid(region ~ soiltype,
             labeller = labeller(region = region.labs, 
                                 soiltype = soiltype.labs)
  ) +
  scale_x_discrete(guide = guide_axis(angle = 45)) +
  labs(x = "Initial density and resistance of Black-grass population", 
       y = "Mean annual gross profit (Â£/ha)") +
  # specify colours for 'scenario':
  scale_color_manual(name = "Scenario",
                     values = c("#00306F", # BAU, madison blue
                                "#00C2F9"  # MIT, capri blue
                                )
                     )+ 
  scale_shape_manual(name = "Scenario",
                     values=c(15, 16)) + # BAU, 15 = square; MIT, 16 = circle
  theme(strip.placement = 'outside',
        strip.text.x = element_text(size = 16),
        strip.text.y = element_text(size = 16),
        plot.title = element_text(size=22),
        axis.title=element_text(size=18),
        axis.text.x=element_text(size=rel(1.7)),
        axis.text.y=element_text(size=rel(1.7)),
        legend.title=element_text(size=18),
        legend.text=element_text(size=16)
        ) +
  geom_pointrange(aes(ymin = gp_ci_l, 
                      ymax = gp_ci_u
                      ), 
                  position=position_dodge(width=0.3),
                  size = 0.9) +
  theme(legend.position="none") + 
  geom_text(data = anno_gp, aes(x = x,  y = y, label = lab),
           colour = "grey",  size=6) 

plot_scatter_gp
```

95% CIs show year-to-year variation.  


### 3.1.1. Gross profit scatter plot using subscripts

Specify the plot.   
```{r plot-scatter-gp-subscr}
plot_scatter_gp_subscr <- ggplot(df_scatter_gp %>%

                   shape = scenario)) + 
  #geom_point(size = 4) +
  facet_grid(region ~ soiltype,
             labeller = labeller(region = region.labs, 
                                 soiltype = soiltype.labs)
  ) +
  scale_x_discrete(#guide = guide_axis(angle = 45),
                   labels = c(expression('D'['l']*'-R'['l']),
                              expression('D'['l']*'-R'['h']), 
                              expression('D'['h']*'-R'['h'])
                              )
                   ) +
  labs(x = "Initial density and resistance of Black-grass population", 
       y = "Mean annual gross profit (Â£/ha)") +
  # specify colours for 'scenario':
  scale_color_manual(name = "Scenario",
                     values = c("#00306F", # BAU, madison blue
                                "#00C2F9"  # MIT, capri blue
                                )
                     )+ 
  scale_shape_manual(name = "Scenario",
                     values=c(15, 16)) + # BAU, 15 = square; MIT, 16 = circle
  theme(strip.placement = 'outside',
        strip.text.x = element_text(size = 16),
        strip.text.y = element_text(size = 16),
        plot.title = element_text(size=22),
        axis.title=element_text(size=18),
        axis.text.x=element_text(size=rel(2)),
        axis.text.y=element_text(size=rel(2)),
        legend.title=element_text(size=18),
        legend.text=element_text(size=16)
        ) +
  geom_pointrange(aes(ymin = gp_ci_l, 
                      ymax = gp_ci_u
                      ), 
                  position=position_dodge(width=0.3),
                  size = 0.9) +
  theme(legend.position="none") + 
  geom_text(data = anno_gp, aes(x = x,  y = y, label = lab),
           colour = "grey",  size=6) 
plot_scatter_gp_subscr
```

Figure shows: Mean annual opportunity costs of switching from BAU to MIT rotations (i.e., the chosen option is MIT; the foregone option is BAU), for current conditions and worst-case conditions. âCurrentâ opportunity costs are calculated as BAU, current density â MIT, current density. âWorst-case â opportunity costs are calculated as BAU, worst-case density â MIT, current density. âWorst-caseâ is defined as 100% of surveyed grid cells in a field having very high black-grass density. **Points below the line at y=0 indicate that MIT strategies did better than BAU strategies.** Error bars are 95% CIs. x-axis abbreviations: D, density; R, resistance; L, low; H, high. Annotations show numbers of spring crops in the 6-year rotation.

# 8. SI: Scatter plot, density - LD-HR with init HD
Scatter plot of density by 3 init conditions, just BAU and MIT scenarios. Use the `prophvh_3dr` dataset: this contains the mean proportion of squares in high or very high density states, with initial density/resistance states collapsed to three levels.

N.B. I checked whether it made any difference to the error bars if I calculated the mean first, then collapsed init den res levels and combined h&vh, then calculated new mean, OR if I collapsed init den res levels and combined h&vh first and then calculated mean. It made no difference.

###        To the above plot I need to add the LD-HR scenario run with initial high density.
**Lines 482-584 have not been updated since receiving the final density simulations from Rob G, 13th Feb 2023.**
See original script, "03b. Analyse simulated density data.R", lines 480-550.
Also see section at line 962.

For fields with high initial density, I want to see whether black-grass density is reduced by the LD-HR strategies. In these fields, the HD-HR strategies did successfully reduce BG density, but would LD-HR strategies also be successful?

#### Load data
```{r, eval=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
prophvh_3dr_hd <- read.csv("../output/simulated_yearly_mean_prophvh_3dr_hd.csv",

    scenario = factor(scenario),

    initDR3 = factor(initDR3),
    strategy = factor(strategy)
  )
```
